nodes.bodyText: why do we add String.format?  Can't we just drop the second set of braces?

I don't think you can mix message arguments and a throwable. /** * Log a message at the DEBUG level according to the specified format * and arguments. *

*

This form avoids superfluous object creation when the logger * is disabled for the DEBUG level.

* * @param format the format string * @param arg1 the first argument * @param arg2 the second argument */ public void debug(String format, Object arg1, Object arg2); https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.slf4j/slf4j-api/1.7.1/org/slf4j/Logger.html#debug(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.Object,%20java.lang.Object) /** * Log an exception (throwable) at the DEBUG level with an * accompanying message. * * @param msg the message accompanying the exception * @param t the exception (throwable) to log */ public void debug(String msg, Throwable t); https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.slf4j/slf4j-api/1.7.1/org/slf4j/Logger.html#debug(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.Throwable)
LOGGER.debug("Couldn't get availability on source {}", servicePID, e); should work; we do it all the time

You're right. I just confirmed that it gets logged the same either way, even with more than one message argument 👍 I'd like to keep it using String.format for these ones that I fixed so that it aligns with the javadoc.
We do add extra processing cost by adding a String.format to these log statements.  In my opinion, since we use this paradigm already, it might not be worth the tradeoff.
